intro: Cochlidiosperma praecox, commonly known as the early cochlidiosperma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
